Description.p: Functioned as a project manager for a yearlong effort that provided consulting for processes, design and development of dozens of end user training products. These products were created using their customized content development platform, HP Adoption Readiness Tool (ART).

A project to deliver a world class search experience to Mass Mutual's FieldNet users. The deliverable incorporated multiple data sources and utilized Ultraseek 6.0 as the search engine. Avalon's custom Unified Search Platform (USP) was incorporated in the solution scenario to give maximum control and flexibility to the UI. Additionally, the project integrated Baynote social search to further enhance the search experience.
Mr. Barona managed the project as well as the implementation team of analysts, architects and developers.

Mr. Barona managed an implementation team of analysts, architects and developers to deliver several search capabilities for multiple business streams within WSIB. The Autonomy based search solutions either provide enterprise level search capabilities where there are currently none, or enhance the existing search capabilities of a product by incorporating "fuzzy" search capabilities. Avalon's search solutions are part of WSIB's movement out of paper based business processes and into a completely electronic and automated paradigm.

Mr. Barona managed the project to create a public facing search application that delivers better search results for products and services to BD customers. Utilizing the Ultraseek 6.0 platform and Oracle Fetch Connector, the BD search application is designed in way to make quite a few changes like fields to display in a search results page as well as sequence of fields displayed in various popups. Most of these changes can be made without making any programming changes. This project represented a major change for BD Biosciences public facing website and commerce strategy.

Mr. Barona managed the Autonomy search implementation for Pepsi's bottler portal, which provided the client with an internal enterprise search application that crossed multiple business groups and data sources.
